thread.title: 5 things we want to know from Rutgers coach Kyle Flood
thread.title_full: 5 things we want to know from Rutgers coach Kyle Flood

author: app.com
title: 5 things we want to know from Rutgers coach Kyle Flood
text:
MORE Kyle Flood has some explaining to do.
The Rutgers football coach is expected to speak to media at noon today for the first time since he was suspended three games and fined $50,000 by the school on Sept. 16 , after an investigation determined he initiated impermissible contact with a faculty member regarding a player’s grade.
Since then, Flood has run the program six days a week, but handed over gameday coaching and all media responsibilities to assistant head coach Norries Wilson.
Flood will be back on the sideline Saturday at Indiana in a crucial swing game for Rutgers, but first he will be in front of the podium to face tough questions after mostly declining comment citing an ongoing investigation and releasing a prepared statement ever since controversy began.
Here are five questions Flood figures to face regarding his own actions and the actions of those in his program:
Many of Flood’s covert actions uncovered in the investigation contradict the idea that he didn’t know he was breaking a rule. How does he explain that? Whether it is using his personal email account, wearing non-descript clothing to an in-person meeting with the teacher to avoid recognition, or allegedly saying “This conversation never happened” and ignoring the advice of an academic support member, Flood’s actions are not in concert with naivety.
When his actions were first reported, Flood quickly went on the attack , defending his integrity.
After his suspension, Flood said in a statement that “I take full responsibility and accept the consequences of my actions,” but he stopped short of an apology or acknowledging wrongdoing.
After all, Flood was told multiple times in private that the player would be academically ineligible, but his public words and his private actions showed a refusal to accept the decision as final .
